subject: Including crosswalk in arm64 images
commitMessage:
Including crosswalk in arm64 images

During developement stage of arm64 building process,
adding crosswalk to images was not efficient. Thus now
that arm64 building process is landing, the images must
include crosswalk.

The MinimalX11 and MinimalWayland platforms are not
more used after that modification.

Change-Id: If45aedadbf67d245e70e92c05f1d99c9cb2b9f42
Signed-off-by: José Bollo <jose.bollo@open.eurogiciel.org>

commitMessage:
Tizen login manager (tlm) has been added to
generic base, so tlm-config-common will enable
tlm service for Tizen common
user sessions will be started by tlm so removed from
ks

package name as it will fetch gumd, libgum and gum-utils)

subject: change boot partition size to 32MB for odroid u3
commitMessage:
change boot partition size to 32MB for odroid u3

This patch changes boot partition size from 64MB to 32MB
because we don't want to waste too much size for boot
partition.

Change-Id: Ice1bbe8951f8bbb24451307ed6ff009b1f237cb0
Signed-off-by: Chanho Park <chanho61.park@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

should be ok I dont know any kernel larger that 32MB do you ?

Patch Set 1:

We always use compressed zImage for arm kernel. Even it is uncompressed image, it will be smaller than 20MB. So, 32MB is reasonable size to us.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: add 'guest' user to vconf_bt group
commitMessage:
add 'guest' user to vconf_bt group

bluetooth vconf keys are installed by bluetooth-frwk with vconf_bt group owner.
bt-service daemon which runs as 'guest' user can not access those vconf keys.
So after 'guest' user creation, I add it to vconf_bt group.
By this way, bt-service will be available to check and update bluetooth vconf keys.

Change-Id: I2cd7a94f6042a986e1776978c60b288e4c2f61e1
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

tested in command lines, not after generating the image.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

could check if group exists before
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: define new platforms MinimalWayland and MinimalX11 for arm64
commitMessage:
define new platforms MinimalWayland and MinimalX11 for arm64

Crosswalk is not available (yet) for aarch64 architecture. So
Wayland and X11 images can't be built, as they depend on Crosswalk patterns.

This patch defines two new kind of images: MinimalWayland and MinimalX11.

These are the same as Wayland and X11 platforms, except that Crosswalk has been removed.

Change-Id: I46f7bf4d43309c9f5775471baf02ca1d2027c17f
Signed-off-by: Stephane Desneux <stephane.desneux@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: split boot image from snapshot image
commitMessage:
split boot image from snapshot image

This patch intends to change partitions of arm from 4 to 3 partitions
because it is better to split a boot image from the snapshot image. I
think other boards like RD-PQ, Galaxy Gear2 and Renesas board want to
run a test using common arm image. By splitting the boot image from
snapshot image, we can download the snapshot image not only for odroid but
also for other boards.

Change-Id: Ia7aa4968f587b37b23e4a00a13a8889af1c73c70
Signed-off-by: Chanho Park <chanho61.park@samsung.com>
Bug-Tizen: TC-1486

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated

Patch Set 2:

maybe we should name some files differently: 'mbr' has nothing to do here...

Anyway, I think that this should also be unified with the 2parts images (versatile arm kernel) which are in the same situation.

Finally, we don't need specific /opt partitions in Tizen:Common. Could we build all images with only 2 partitions ? (1 boot, 1 root)

Thanks

Patch Set 2:

To sdx,

Typically, arm and mobile devices tend to keep root partition to read-only because it can be broken frequently. So, we store some data for system in /opt partition. The /opt/usr partition is to store user data and to install user applications. So, we want to keep these partition scheme.

Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Chanho, did you remove the Kernel in the *-3parts-* images on purpose ? What will happen if the kernel has modules to be loaded after init ?

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

The boot image is consist of below files:

arm-odroidu3-linux-kernel
 - /boot/zImage : kernel image
 - /boot/*.dtb : device tree blob
arm-odroidu3-linux-kernel-modules
 - /boot/modules.img : kernel modules image

I missed arm-odroidu3-linux-kernel-modules package to install the kernel modules. I'm not sure whether specifying PrePackage is working or not.

-PrePackages: u-boot
+PrePackages: u-boot arm-odroidu3-linux-kernel-moduoles
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

- Comments: SR 29717 is set to accepted
- Git project: profile/common/meta
- Tag:submit/tizen_common/20141030.231434
- Request URL:https://build.tizen.org/request/show/29717

subject: Added filter definitions of image with build target
commitMessage:
Added filter definitions of image with build target

One new file was added: common-targets.yaml. Inside it, the relationship of
images and build targets is defined. It means which image belong to which
target, and the backend services will only generate the proper images for
specific target, to avoid current image duplication issue. It need also cowork
with the new update of `kickstarter` command, and image-configurations build
instruction.

Change-Id: Id3e6ac491b5da059be3f8abc13fa15e551bceb1d
Signed-off-by: Lin Yang <lin.a.yang@intel.com>

subject: support 4 partitions for arm odroid u3
commitMessage:
support 4 partitions for arm odroid u3

This patch supports 4 partitions for arm odroid u3 which is reference
target of arm. Unlike tizen-2.2.1, we want to change partition maps of
arm target because platform.img/data.img/ums.img are really ambiguous from
developers. To clarify the partition name, we decide to change partition
names.

/boot: boot.img
/: rootfs.img
/opt: system-data.img
/opt/usr: user.img

Change-Id: I3208ee7404dcc6a5fd72c2e8af0fac67b7023af0
Signed-off-by: Chanho Park <chanho61.park@samsung.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: common-packaging.post: better generation of .repo files
commitMessage:
common-packaging.post: better generation of .repo files

Zypper repo files are now generated using the information
stored in /etc/tizen-build.conf.

This allows to generate 4 repo files with accurate information
whatever the profile, obs repository etc.:
- snapshot: corresponds to the current snapshot
- update: latest snapshot
- daily: latest daily release
- weekly: latest weekly release

Debug repositories are also defined in the same .repo files.

Change-Id: I0ea07d7383499529d74a764de0ec69e9333ae54f
Signed-off-by: Stephane Desneux <stephane.desneux@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: remove net-config from Tizen:Common images
commitMessage:
remove net-config from Tizen:Common images

net-config is conflicting with connman in that we cannot
run connman in agent mode. Removing it from the image as
it's not used or needed in Tizen:Common.

Signed-off-by: Ulf Hofemeier <ulf.hofemeier@linux.intel.com>
Change-Id: I4c3ce8f6cf0063a69f68275e139c42f57f725e45

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified-1 Code-Review-1

It will break the Download API : net-config updates Vconf table which are used in this API.

A new network API is currently in study in order to replace net-config/settings-deamon mess, here is the issue :
https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/PTAPI-35.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

currently there's no explicit dependency on net-config. So it's safe to remove it from image. I won't remove it from repo and it should be pulled by dependencies.

Patch Set 1:

True Stephane is right net-config could be removed from the image without removing other package...

This mean 

1/ it's not used 

2/ some dependencies are missing in clients of this package

I think we're on 2/ and the change is valid

But there is a bigger issue that should be raised in our bug tracker if we want to use connman and net-config at the same time (which IICR is not supported) ...

Patch Set 1:

I think we can drop net-config for the image until winet lands, which I learned today is supposed to happen in about 4 weeks.

Patch Set 1:

Let's fix the commit msg -:) but most important, we must open a bug to fix bad dependencies on net-config. 

If net-config is removed explicitely from the image, it must be pulled by the other dependent packages (which is not the case). Who can handle the inquiry on net-config dependent packages and open a bug to fix them ?

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

As Ulf said, the WiNet API should be delivered in a few weeks.
It will replace the mess around net-config and settings-daemon.

Knowing that, we can remove net-config from Tizen Common to already.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Counting on the +1s
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 2:

Just for info, Romuald added a 'net-config' runtime  dependency in download-provider component. This is necessary to use Download API.

https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/24123/3

Patch Set 1:

The SR (Submit Request) has been *rejected* to OBS Tizen:Common project.
- Reviewer: sdx
- Comments: SR 27156 is set to declined(This merge doesnt conform to the usual way to declare groups in profile/common/meta. Group name is not very explicit and theres not associated postscript. Please adjust this patch, submit a new one on gerrit and let everyone review it. BTW, profile/common/meta may not be the best place to declare the group: see PTREL-807. Thanks.)
- Git project: profile/common/meta
- Tag:submit/tizen_common/20140707.050931
- Commit: 0a3903b4dad4e83f3f1733329c7547ebb385fec0
- Request URL:https://build.tizen.org/request/show/27156

Patch Set 1:

The submission of this patch on Tizen:Common has been rejected.

Reasons:
* This merge doesn't conform to the usual way to declare groups in profile/common/meta (postscript even if empty is missing - see other groups). 
* Group name is not very explicit 
* profile/common/meta may not be the best place to declare the group: see PTREL-807 

Please adjust this patch, submit a new one on gerrit and let everyone review it. 

Thanks.

subject: crosswalk: start xwalk service through dbus
commitMessage:
crosswalk: start xwalk service through dbus

- added dbus.service as a wanted service for user session
- removed xwalk.service from default target in user session
  xwalk should now be started through systemd dbus activation
- moved xwalk_preinstall_service to wrt-widgets
  (used to trigger wrt-widgets preinstall at first boot)
- cleanup of crosswalk postinst script: no need to append launchers
  to weston.ini

Change-Id: I9db5bd22cdd70d8ecc51b4ab506f30c2732eb1c8
Signed-off-by: Stephane Desneux <stephane.desneux@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: installer: add 'quiet' in kernel command line
commitMessage:
installer: add 'quiet' in kernel command line

installer image runs an installer script that uses
dialog on the console. Adding 'quiet' to the kernel
command line makes the kernel and systemd less verbose
on the console to avoid poluting the installer visuals

subject: Support image creation on backend jenkins
commitMessage:
Support image creation on backend jenkins

The jenkins new release 0.15.3 with image creation feature will be deployed
soon. At the first step, BOSS and jenkins will run in parallel to verifiy the
new feature. This change add new ks to support image creation in jenkins,
which will not block image creation in BOSS. After shutdown BOSS and swith to
jenkins, these temporary ks will be cleaned up.

Change-Id: I47e64538bdce5f9ffe1fc7afc64de92ca63caa4b
Signed-off-by: Lin Yang <lin.a.yang@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Now the needed bluetooth daemons will be installed in the image.

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/tizen_common/20140425.143724 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit ff5e0c3793c1f59857013a0f4693a6662a30ea9d in tizen_common branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in tizen_common branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".
